ygData.subject: Re: BUG/FEEDBACK
ygData.msgSnippet: Seems like this would be an example of us using our heads to trap and fight monster reaistily. I don t know about you but part of any battle involves having
ygData.messageBody:
Seems like this would be an example of us using our heads to trap and fight
monster reaistily. I don't know about you but part of any battle involves
having the best position and if we can trp a bunch of dumb monsters in a
building and light it up... Well seems like that is using our heads. The
monster can do this to us and we have to scramble to find an exit. They
should have to also.

Mushin

-----Original Message-----
From: mstokes <mstokes@...>
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Date: Saturday, May 01, 1999 3:28 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: BUG/FEEDBACK


>From: mstokes <mstokes@...>
>
>>From what I have read previously, I believe you are both right. It is
>very easy to turn on clipping for monsters, but it would allow an obsene
>amount of exploitable bugs. For instance, if you stand in a certin spot
>and open a door, your character will get stuck in the door.(I have done
>this) If you gain the ability to do this to a monster, it would allow us
>weak mage types to solo mobs that con red. It would also allow players to
>attack linked monsters one at a time by getting one to charge while the
>rest a stuck in a tent or behind a dungeon wall.
>
>Have a good weekend, and Happy Hunting
>Malkin (Fennin Ro)
>
>mprez20@... wrote:
>
>> From: mprez20@...
>>
>> On the contrary I was told that it was VERY hard to make buildings off
>> limits. To implement that code for every creatures AI would have been a
>> large task and due to time constraints was not implemented
>
>Just to inform everyone. This behavior where monsters can attack through
>solid object is not a glitch. It is a choice they have made, the code to
>turn clipping on for
>monsters is there. It would be very easy for them to make it so that
>monsters cannot attack through things, but they have chosen to allow this.
>I personally can't
>think of any reasons why they would allow this to happen, but I'm sure they
>have their reasons.
>
>Tandayen, Dark Elf Wizard
>
>
>>
>>
>
>
>
